This allowed to remove the compile-time constraint in the library. Users can even use at the same time a field for 20 decimals digits precision and another field for 100 digits precision. All step interpolators for ODE integrators now provide interpolation for both the state and its time derivatives. The interpolated derivatives are the exact derivatives of the interpolated state, thus preserving consistency. The general step handlers hence do not need to call the derivation function anymore. The fixed step handlers also get the time derivative of the state as an additional argument along with the state when they are called.
